summary: The Reorganizing Government Act of 2025 (S. 583) amends Chapter 9 of Title 5 of the United States Code, concerning executive reorganization. It reauthorizes presidential authority to reorganize executive departments. Key provisions include the elimination of unnecessary operations, reducing the number of federal employees, streamlining regulations, and eliminating operations not serving the public interest. The bill also updates definitions and revises timelines for reorganization plans. The aim is to increase efficiency and potentially reduce government costs.
